Description: Reconstructed sherds of neck of black figure painted pottery situla. Bull, in field incised rosettes: below, parts of lotus flowers and palmettes. Purple on ear, side-whiskers, shoulder stripe, hooves of bull, and on alternate petals of rosettes.
Curator's comments: Petrie considered that the men with clubs were intended for Egyptians (Tanis ii, 62), and he is probably right; they seem to be circumcised and their way of fighting does not look Greek. BMC B.106.1 (=A) and 5 (=B)
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.5)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 3a)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 601, 1-2; GB 598,6) (Group C9)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 249)
